thread.title: Belfast swings to 10th win, makes strong playoff push
thread.title_full: Belfast swings to 10th win, makes strong playoff push

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Belfast swings to 10th win, makes strong playoff push
text:
Belfast swings to 10th win, makes strong playoff push By Staff | Oct 07, 2015 
Fairfield â€” The Belfast field hockey team notched its 10th win of the season with a 5-2 decision over host Lawrence on Monday, Oct. 5. 
The Lions roared to their 10th victory as they bested another topnotch playoff contender in the Bulldogs. Belfast led 2-0 at halftime. 
Leading the Belfast offense were Victoria Curtis (goal), Anna Baiungo (2 assists), Kelci Faulkingham (goal), Kylie Nelson (goal, 2 assists), Alicia Gaiero (goal), Hannah Sanderson (assist) and Amy Gaiero (goal). 
For Lawrence, Lauren Watson scored one of the team's two goals. 
Morgan Fernald made nine saves on 11 shots in the cage for Belfast, while Emily Tozier made nine saves on 14 shots in goal for Lawrence. The Lions held an 11-6 advantage in penalty corners. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (10-2, 93.8776) is third. Winslow (8-3-1, 99.9235 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs.
